roleset.name: drive or be driven around in a vehicle
roleset.note: DRIVE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'drive' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entries nonvehicle-51.4.2, drive-11.5.Other framed members include ride. Comparison to ride and Chris' oldframes file.These two senses should probably be merged. (from drive.01-v predicate notes)
DRIVE-N NOTES: Based on drive-v.01. (from drive.01-n predicate notes)
DRIVE_AROUND-N NOTES: Based on drive-v.01. (from drive.02-n predicate notes)

example.name: somewhat idiomatic
example.text: ``The more variables that indicate risk, the more [the investor]-1 is going *trace*-1 to drive a hard bargain.''

example.name: now that's dedication
example.text: John drove 50 miles in the driving snow to annotate predicate-argument structure.

example.name: light verb
example.text: PRO Take a quick drive around the country.

example.name: light verb
example.text: The police did a drive around with the cabby.

example.name: Arg0, 1
example.text: His driving that rusty RV down the street every July 4th at 6am was an event that you could set your watch to.
example.arg: that rusty RV down the street

roleset.name: cause to move or become, impelled, inspired
roleset.note: DRIVE-V NOTES: The second direction is more clearly parenthetical, so it should stayas an ArgM while the other is anArg2. (from drive.02-v)
DRIVEN-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, drive-v.02.(from driven.01-j)

example.name: straightforward predication
example.text: In an invention that *trace* drives Verdi purists bananas, Violetta lies dying in bed during the prelude, rising deliriouslywhen then she remembers the great parties she used to throw.

example.name: predication as direction
example.text: Each of them contributed a section at the behest of Verdi, who *trace*-1 was nearly driven *trace*-1 to his own early grave by thetroublesome arrangements.

example.name: stupid stock reports
example.text: [Georgia-Pacific's $3.18 billion bid for Great Northern Nekoosa]-1 helped *trace*-1 drive the Dow Jones Industrial Average up 41.60 points, to 2645.08, in active trading.

roleset.name: desire for something
roleset.note: DRIVE-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, part 7. Framed by Claire. (from drive.03-n)

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: Chinese society absolutely can not indulge in a redistribution of wealth and lose the drive and edge for creating wealth.

example.name: All args
example.text: His drive for success in the automotive sales industry is fueled by his passion and interest in cars.
example.arg: for success in the automotive sales industry

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: I am driven to help this team win, go deeper in the playoffs and win a Super Bowl.
example.arg: to help this team win, go deeper in the playoffs and win a Super Bowl

roleset.name: Cause, effort, campaign
roleset.note: Based on ontonouns. Comparison with campaign.01. Framed by Katie (from drive.04-n)

example.name: All args
example.text: The school's canned food drive for the homeless shelter.
